txt.en:
'The Orcs will be reeling from your assault for a great long time, [placeholder]. I am certain of that.

'Now, we must work to ensure that no more of their ilk slip past our defences and into the Sutcrofts.

'Travel out to the pathway that leads into the East Wall. You will find barricades there, but unfortunately, none of my men. Due to your efforts, I can now afford to have my riders defend those positions. Signal them from the barricades and they will hold the position.

'Return to me when this is done.'
'Excellent, those Orcs should find much more trouble waiting for them when they pass out of the East Wall. Now then, more must be done.'
Winsig wants to ensure that the East Wall remains barricaded to the best of Walstow's ability. She can spare a few riders, and wishes for you to signal some to take up a position near the Wall.
The barricades can be found along the road near the East Wall to the north and north-west of Walstow.
The guard-captain of Walstow can be found at the north end of Walstow.
